memberdef.name: LOG_CONS
memberdef.initializer: (2 << 12) /* log to the system console on error */

briefdescription.para: Log to the system console on error.

memberdef.name: LOG_NDELAY
memberdef.initializer: (8 << 12) /* connect to the syslog daemon immediately */

briefdescription.para: Connect to the syslog daemon immediately.

memberdef.name: LOG_NOWAIT
memberdef.initializer: (64 << 12) /* do not wait for child processes */

briefdescription.para: Do not wait for child processes.

memberdef.name: LOG_ODELAY
memberdef.initializer: (4 << 12) /* delay open until syslog() is called */

briefdescription.para: Delay open until syslog() is called.
Dump to stderr as well.

memberdef.name: LOG_PID
memberdef.initializer: (1 << 12) /* log the process (thread/team) ID with each message */

briefdescription.para: Log the process (thread/team) ID with each message.

memberdef.name: LOG_SERIAL
memberdef.initializer: (16 << 12) /* dump to serial output as well (not implemented) */

briefdescription.para: Dump to serial output as well.
Standard POSIX facility(?) for messages by the authentication services.
Reserved for private (?) messages that relate to authentication.
Reserved for messages generated by the CRON daemon.
Standard POSIX (?) facility for messages by daemons (and Haiku servers).
Reserved for messages generated by the kernel.

For local use.
Reserved for messages generated by the UNIX lpr printing tool.
Standard (?) POSIX facility for messages by the mailing daemon.
Reserved for messages generated by something UNIXy that does something with NEWS.
Reserved for messages generated by the syslog daemon.
Reserved for messages generated by user processes.
Reserved for messages generated by UUCP.

sectiondef.header: Priorities for syslog(), log_team() and log_thread()

memberdef.name: LOG_ALERT
memberdef.initializer: 1 /* a condition that should be corrected immediately */

briefdescription.para: A condition to that should be corrected immediately.

memberdef.name: LOG_CRIT
memberdef.initializer: 2 /* critical conditions like hard drive errors */

briefdescription.para: Critical conditions like hard drive errors.
Debug information.
A panic condition.
Errors.
Information, like versions and so.
Notices, instructions on how to use certain configuration options.
An alias for LOG_EMERG.
Warnings.

Closes the current log session.
Closes the log.
Closes the log.
sends a message to the system log
sends a message to the system log
Starts a log session, and sets some output options.

detaileddescription.para: Like openlog_thread() this function defines the log session in thread context; the global options set by openlog_team() are not affected by this function.

briefdescription.para: Starts a log session, and sets some output options.

detaileddescription.para: This function defines the team-wide logging options. Thread local sessions started with openlog() or openlog_thread() will inherit the options of the global session.

briefdescription.para: Starts a log session, and sets some output options.
sets the logging priority mask
sets the logging priority mask
sets the logging priority mask
sends a message to the system log
System logging capabilities.

detaileddescription.para: The functions described here are interacting with the syslog_daemon, a server that provides the system logging capabilities. The log can be found in /var/log/syslog.
